How can I add a title to a legend in a matplotlib plot? I'm currently using the following code to generate a plot with a legend, but I can't figure out how to add a title to the legend.

Here's my current code:

```python
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

one = mpatches.Patch(facecolor='#f3f300', label='label1', linewidth = 0.5, edgecolor = 'black')
two = mpatches.Patch(facecolor='#ff9700', label = 'label2', linewidth = 0.5, edgecolor = 'black')
three = mpatches.Patch(facecolor='#ff0000', label = 'label3', linewidth = 0.5, edgecolor = 'black')

legend = plt.legend(handles=[one, two, three], loc = 4, fontsize = 'small', fancybox = True)

frame = legend.get_frame() #sets up for color, edge, and transparency
frame.set_facecolor('#b4aeae') #color of legend
frame.set_edgecolor('black') #edge color of legend
frame.set_alpha(1) #deals with transparency
plt.show()
```

I want the title of the legend to be positioned above 'label1'. Here's the current output of my code: ![Current Output](https://i.stack.imgur.com/qK0hz.png)

To add a title to the legend in your Matplotlib plot, you can use the `title` parameter of the `plt.legend()` function. You simply need to include this parameter in your `plt.legend()` call, specifying the desired title as a string. Here's how you can modify your existing code to include a legend title:

```python
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

one = mpatches.Patch(facecolor='#f3f300', label='label1', linewidth=0.5, edgecolor='black')
two = mpatches.Patch(facecolor='#ff9700', label='label2', linewidth=0.5, edgecolor='black')
three = mpatches.Patch(facecolor='#ff0000', label='label3', linewidth=0.5, edgecolor='black')

# Adding a title to the legend
legend = plt.legend(handles=[one, two, three], loc=4, fontsize='small', fancybox=True, title="Legend Title")

frame = legend.get_frame()  # Sets up for color, edge, and transparency
frame.set_facecolor('#b4aeae')  # Color of legend
frame.set_edgecolor('black')    # Edge color of legend
frame.set_alpha(1)              # Deals with transparency

plt.show()
```

In this example, `"Legend Title"` is the title of the legend, and it will be positioned above the legend entries. You can customize the title further by using additional legend properties if needed.
